name: methyl 3-[bis(methylsulfanyl)methyl]-4-cyano-2-hydroxy-2,5-diphenylcyclopent-3-ene-1-carboxylate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1667
Reason: 3-phenyl-2-methyl-2,5-diphenylcyclopent-1-ene has a melting point influenced by the functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The basic unit we can compare to is the melting point of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of two additional phenyl rings. Phenyl groups, when connected to a benzene ring, tend to increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. In the case of 3-phenyl-2-methyl-2,5-diphenylcyclopent-1-ene, we have two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would notably augment the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
